intro: Trigonocarpus cymosus, commonly known as the clustered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit with a fibrous root system adapted to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-gray hue, while the flowers are typically white or pale yellow. Trigonocarpus cymosus is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
